rComments: Ro was great, he was extremely helpful. There were only two exams (midterm and final), which were both a bit challenging. But as long as you put a lot of effort into this course by doing the homework, you could definitely end up with an A since his curves are massive. Go to lecture and take the course seriously!

His class is difficult because your only grade is the tests. However, there is a huge curve so you should pass if you know some material. He is funny despite being an 8am class. If  you are having a hard time understanding go to his office hours; they are really helpful. Overall, stressful but doable :)

Kamakaka is an amazing professor who really wants his students to succeed. Although his tests may be really difficult, it's not impossible if you have done all the homework. He also throws in a huge curve so there really isn't a reason for anyone to fail if they put in a minimum amount of effort for his class

Ro was one of the best professors I've had. I took his class at 8am and the level of participation for an 8am class was incredible. He draws students into his lecture with his enthusiasm. That being said, it was a really difficult class. Definitely go to every lecture, go to office hours, and section. He is very helpful in his office hours.

One of the most intersting subject, but it is hard as heck, dedicate time to read, do the homework, attend office hours if you dont know how to do a problem. Highly recommend him, very good professor.

It was a tough class and it required going to office hours, sections, reading the book, and doing homework to get a good grade. He is really helpful. I would recommend reading the book after lecture and then going to his office hours to ask questions.

this professor did a very great job at explaining the material and giving you what you needed to know for the exams, the exam are highly doable. But like any class, the professor expects you to do a considerable amount of studying, you need to read the book, do ALL the HW, go to section/office hour, put in a good effort and you will be fine
Will be one of the most challenging bio classes you will ever encounter. Professor is really knowledgeable.

Genetics is a hard subject in general. This is not your type of easy intro bio class, it's a more challenging course but definitely do-able. Go to lecture and understand his lectures, and do ALL homework problems because exams are mostly homework problems reworded. Try your best to pay attention in lecture as well.

I love this professor. The first part of this class deals with a lot of old material like mitosis and Mendel. But once the tough stuff shows up, Ro does a great job explaining everything. Do the homework, go to office hours and you'll do great!

Was not a huge fan of taking this class but now after having Ro loved the class. This class is not necessarly easy and does require you to study but Ro is very approachable and loves to answer questions. Read the book, go to section and you will do fine. Also attend his office hours he is very helpful in explaining the difficult concepts.

He is an amazing professor! He is personable, kind, enthusiastic, helpful, clear and excited for you when you understand the material. His class does take a lot of work though. I got my first A in a science based class because I went to section, office hours, MSI and did all the homework that he recommended.

Great professor, very helpful, but gives brain killer tests! the class is interesting HOWEVER, genetics is probably one of the hardest bio class you'll ever take unless you're one of the few who are naturally good at it. He gave us a practice final, but the actual test was 2x as long & hard. I studied SOOOO much, he curves but I still didn't pass.
Wow. this class was really hard. Like i want to cry at times hard. but i passed so its all good.

This class is way too hard. I have studied for it for more than any class I have been in and it STILL doesn't make sense and I can't get the problems right. His lectures are too fast and unclear. He is a nice guy and funny, but not a good teacher.

Not a bad professor, but TERRIBLE exams- pop quiz the first day of class? OK, but chastising everyone for not doing well? what did you expect?! 1.5 hr time limit on the mid-term? why? horrid final exam that barely anyone finishes in 3 hours, difficulty not even approached by lecture / homework examples? inexcusable. Roh needs an exam auditor.

nice guy. class included of print-out notes, which he would follow suit & write notes out as the lecture progressed, midterm and a final. I did horrible on the midterm since i didnt study however, i killed the final & got an overall B+; im ashamed i did badly on the first midterm.theres no reason to fail this course, goto class forthe inclass probs
Good lecturer, do suggested problems

Loved this professor.  His lectures were strait forward and easy to follow.  He was clear and would gladly go over things again if a question was asked.  The book was useful, but he never made it clear what we needed to read, so you have to figure that out for yourself
excellent professor, funny and nice.

Ro was very clear in lectures, and was very helpful outside of class. His lectures outline what he wants you to know, so read the book for more detail; he WILL test you on details found in the reading that weren't covered in the broad outline during class. Genetics is difficult, but he did a GREAT job teaching it.

It wasn't an easy class, but as long as you go to lecture, section and do the assigned homework problems, you'll do fine. If you have trouble with the HW problems, go to MSI. I completely recommend those. Saved my butt. Ro is very approachable. Know what's going on before the midterm and final because that's all you get graded on.

His tests were a bit difficult even with having done the homework and read the chapters. However he was a great lecturer. There was never a dull moment in this 8am class. His notes were a little spacey and ultimately only slightly aided the reading in the text and the hwk problems. Overall, after having taken this class before, I think he's the bes

Get very familiar with the textbook, do all homework and live at the library. Study and then study some more. Don't complain about how hard it is,  make the sacrifice, no partying all quarter, study like mad. Trust me this is the trick for this class.
He's not generous with the grading at all. failed like 25% of the class. He should find another topic to teach.

Professor=Very nice. Class consists of one midterm and one final. Midterm was not bad, but his final was very difficult (that was what brought my grade down). Use lectures to study for his tests; use the book to clarify his lectures, but DO NOT read it b/c there are unnecessary info. Go to his office hours; they are very helpful. DO NOT FALL BEHIND
His midterm and final are way too long and the difficulty of his exams is unsurpassed.  This class has ruined me, this teacher should lighten up on the difficulty factor.

Ro really wants you to do well. If you take good notes during class you'll be fine. Don't bother stressing out about the text just understand his examples in class and study his old midterms and finals.

Ro is a little hard to understand at times (I believe he's Indian?) but his lectures were well laid out and made sense for the most part. His homeworks prepared well for the tests, which were all in all fair. Genetics is actually a very interesting course if you pay attention.

I enjoyed this class a lot more than I expected because of Ro's enthusiasm & clear explanations.  You do have to keep up with the homework and go to lecture, but if you do that, it's not hard to do well.

Kamakaka didn't seem very approachable or obviously friendly but his lectures were very clear and explanitory. I felt that his tests were fair, so fair the curve wasn't very useful. But his lectures made the class doable.

I don't know why everyone from the summer loved him so much. I wish he would have used those power points that they were talking about because in our class, he used poorly written over head projections that were always crooked. Plus, he changed them so fast, you couldn't even take notes. I found his teaching to be very frustrating. nice guy though!

Excellent professor! His class was truly enjoyable. He made this subject very interesting and presented it in a captivating way. Powerpoints were organized and clear - mainly study the powerpoints for the test and use book to supplement. He is also extremely helpful in office hours, and never brushes you off.

Awesome professor! Extremely clear on every lecture topic, and the overheads he uses make everything even easier to understand. Everything he tests on is online so studying is easy. His lectures were actually enjoyable! An all around awesome guy.

His lectures were very clear and to the point. If you just focus on this lecture notes you will know all you need to know for his exams. He posts everything online so attendence is not quite necessary.. although I would go anyway because he's a bit witty and enjoyable. He twitches a lot when he talks and it kept me entertained. Overall, I thought h
